solution_line_template: It costs {ferris_wheel_rides} rides x {ferris_wheel_cost_per_ride} tickets/ride = <<{ferris_wheel_rides}*{ferris_wheel_cost_per_ride}={ferris_wheel_total_cost}>>{ferris_wheel_total_cost} tickets to ride the Ferris wheel twice.

It costs {roller_coaster_rides} rides x {roller_coaster_cost_per_ride} tickets/ride = <<{roller_coaster_rides}*{roller_coaster_cost_per_ride}={roller_coaster_total_cost}>>{roller_coaster_total_cost} tickets to ride the roller coaster three times.

It costs {log_ride_rides} rides x {log_ride_cost_per_ride} ticket/ride = <<{log_ride_rides}*{log_ride_cost_per_ride}={log_ride_total_cost}>>{log_ride_total_cost} tickets to ride the roller coaster seven times.

In total Dolly needs {ferris_wheel_total_cost} tickets + {roller_coaster_total_cost} tickets + {log_ride_total_cost} tickets = <<{ferris_wheel_total_cost}+{roller_coaster_total_cost}+{log_ride_total_cost}={total_tickets_needed}>>{total_tickets_needed} tickets.
Dolly needs to buy {total_tickets_needed} tickets - {tickets_dolly_has} tickets = <<{total_tickets_needed}-{tickets_dolly_has}={tickets_to_buy}>>{tickets_to_buy} more tickets.
